title: Edge of Tomorrow
description: Major Bill Cage is an officer who has never seen a day of combat when he is unceremoniously demoted and dropped into combat. Cage is killed within minutes, managing to take an alpha alien down with him. He awakens back at the beginning of the same day and is forced to fight and die again... and again - as physical contact with the alien has thrown him into a time loop.

reviews.text: The 're-living sequences' were very entertaining, sometimes comical. There's also good chemistry between Cruise and Blunt, and the premise was interesting enough to keep me captivated for the entirety of the movie.

I was reluctant to see the movie at first (mostly because it's got Tom Cruise and Oblivion last year was pretty disappointing), but eventually came through only to check Emily Blunt. However, I have to admit that I would've missed a lot had I not seen it. The plot might seem dull at first, especially when you think of Groundhog Day or Source Code, but this is, might I say, definitely one of the best science-fiction works ever. Period. Turns out Cruise still has the magic in him, but Blunt is pretty much the major reason why this movie resonates so well with the audience. Without any gigantic marketing gimmicks (in comparison to other summer releases), I really didn't expect the movie to be as good as it is. The visual effect is very smooth, the writing is definitely dashing, and for a movie about repetitions, I am surprised that I didn't even want to miss any scene because the humor, action, sci-fi lectures, and suspense work really well altogether. I expected X-Men: DoFP to be my favorite summer hit this year, but I have to say that this movie definitely steals the spotlight. I hope more people turn out to see it because it's something that you don't want to miss at all (despite the rather cliche ending).

One of the best movies I've seen all year, both myself (Sci-fi, action, war movie fan) and my girlfriend (not a Sci-fi or war movie fan) loved it. The only fault I could find is that the ending was a bit confusing, it left me wondering about the logic of it as I left, but I'm sure a quick google search would help me make sense of it.

Never wrote a movie review in my life, but this one motivate me enough to so.  Best movie I have seen since the first Matrix.  Check it out in IMAX if you can; it will put will right in the D-Day battle.

I'm giving this move a 10 because it has all the elements of an entertaining film - action, suspense, humor and good production value which add up to an entertaining time. Basically it's Groundhog Day meets War of the Worlds. Now I'm a pretty big science fiction fan but I often don't like alien invasion films because the idea that humans are going to win a war against another alien invaders whose technology is hundreds of thousands of years more advanced than us usually falls to some ridiculous idea that although they traveled millions of light years to get here they forgot to check the air or the water before they started their invasion. Edge of tomorrow had a much more creative plot line, which really is the basis of the whole story. I liked the film so much that i went back to see it again with a friend. This films was well adapted and contains enough of the human element to it, so  that even if you're not a Sci-Fi fan you will undoubtedly enjoy it.

Edge of tomorrow was good at all, the movie has good action scenes, there are great actors like Tom Cruise and Emily Blunt, and the movie script surprised me I really liked how the movie time travel works...

A Absolute Fantastic Movie!.The Premise Was interesting,The Visual effects were stunning and an outstanding performance of Tom Cruise.This Movie is a masterpiece that surely needs attention and Highly recommend!

I don't usually go to these kind of movie, and the trailers didn't interest me, but one reviewer said it had a great sense of humor. It does! I also like Emily Blunt....a lot....  It's very well directed, the editing is incredibly good, and the pace never lags, which is good for suspend disbelief Sci-Fi movies, one doesn't have time to think about plot holes. Cruise is good, and starts off well playing against stereotype as a sniveling coward. Blunt gets to be tough in a very sexual masculine/feminine role, and buff! It is the humor that makes this really enjoyable. Who thought that killing someone over and over could be so hilarious?

"Edge of Tomorrow" manages to shrug off the usual hollywood summer movie formula to surprisingly emerge as a refreshing and eye-catching (in some scenes, humorous) action film with a captivating storyline and great acting from Tom Cruise and Emily Blunt.

Woundrous Sci-Fi movie from the lead-off to the end, knacky screenplay and creative context, the movie uses and plays with sort of a revival idea where you never perishes, the day never ends, stunning idea gracefully used, mixed with a great cast and acting, however the use of saturated subject of alien invasion prevented my 10 out 10, however it's a great movie as it stands.

I enjoyed it MUCH more than I thought that I would have.   It really is the sci-fi-action version of Groundhog Day and Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey.  But it has a heart, and the aliens are not TOO annoying.  (Why does every movie this summer - see X-Men - have to have creatures that look like the Sentinels from The Matrix?)  Certainly recommended fare.  I had a smile on my face for most of the film, which is a good sign in my book!

I def was not expecting much from this movie but with all the audience scores being high i figured i would give it a try. I am also glad i did. This is actually a really interesting sic fi movie that actually incorporates some humor here and there as well. Tom did an excellent job of connecting with the viewer and action was abundant but not over done. I liked Emily Blunt in it as well and she did a good job. All in all it was a refreshing movie to watch and different from the latest action movies which mostly comprise of superheroes or sequels so i def recommend a watch but 3D doesn't add anything so you can easily skip the premium pricing.

Awesome Tom Cruise Film!!! one of the best film in his career ,outstanding film since his mission impossible 4, excellent superb screen play keep us thrilled every seconds of the film,truly amazing visual effects, energetic performance by tom and Emily ,both are awesome, superb chemistry between them, powerful direction make edge of tomorrow is a MIND BLOWING VISUAL THRILLING EXPERIENCE .! DON'T MISS IT..!!!

Despite the first-rate acting, the movie is too mind-bendingly unrealistic to join in. After their European blitzkrieg , the aliens are smart enough to not to open the eastern front - evidently making a secret deal with the Soviets to divide the spoils - but STILL can't handle the Normandy beach counterattack?

If exoskeletons and time manipulation are your thing, this movie is for you!  And if they're not... well you'll probably still like it, anyway. I wasn't particularly satisfied with the ending, but the movie never felt boring and as a whole, I enjoyed it very much. A welcome bi-product of the premise was the feeling that anything could happen to the main character at any time. Other movies often fail to deliver any real feeling of fear or surprise, given that you assume the main character will come out the other side with only a few scratches and bruises. But because the anchor of this story is repeatedly living a single day until he dies, the next fatal blow could be right around the corner. This film also provides some welcome realism in that our hero doesn't miraculously dodge every bullet or perform each maneuver perfectly the first time. I found that the filmmakers highlighted this very well and it provided some believability to an otherwise unbelievable story. At any rate, definitely worth my Saturday afternoon and money.

I'm a little dumbfounded that this movie didn't do better at the box office because I found it highly entertaining. The trailer makes it seem like it's going to be very heavy science-fiction but it's not. There are certainly light moments like there were in the movie Groundhog Day.  For all those Tom Cruise haters out there, the real star of this movie is Emily Blunt. She is outstanding and she is underrated as usual.

After the last two Tom Cruise movies I was a bit skeptical about how much I'll enjoy this one. There was no need to be, because this movie is great. The concept is entertaining and the plotting is spot-on. I may have to go in for a second showing. Everyone here plays their role really well and the special effects werent overused or needless. I rarely go to the movie theater now but I'm glad I went in for this movie.

I will start out by saying that I saw this movie yesterday in IMAX 3D and I absolutely loved it. I will begin by saying that I love Tom Cruise as an action actor and that he is def in my Top 5 actors of all time. Now to the review. Acting:I will begin by saying that the acting was top notch of course we have Tom Cruise who is Awesome and also Emily Blunt who was Fantastic. I thought the standout was Bill Paxton who was hilarious in the movie and also Brendan Gleeson who was also great with the few parts he had so acting was Superb. Story:The story I thought was very well put together about the alien Invasion and by the end of the movie while there was still one question it was pieced together nicely. Action Scenes:The action in this movie was Insane it was honestly non-stop from start to finish which I love for a movie like this take all the examples you have seen which combine Starship Troopers and the first scene in Saving Private Ryan and combine them and that is what you get an all out brawl of badass action scenes to rival these movies in particular which are Battle:LA and Battleship which I didn't watch because I heard it sucked but regardless if you love action movies this is def for you. Verdict:I would recommend this movie to anyone who loves comedy and action movies galore. I would say watch it in IMAX but if you can't just watch it in 2D this is the summer blockbuster to start the summer and possibly beat out all the rest and in my opinion is Tom Cruise's best film since my personnel favorite "Collateral"!!!!! A Must See.

Funny and action badass ! If you like Sci-Fi this is a great remix of starship troopers + groundhog day ! I really love this movie ! There is some stupid things on the plot but nothig to worry about if you are looking for a great blockbuster.

loved this movie tom cruise back in the game properly and delivering the only down part of this movie is the chemistry between Emily and tom but with the script theirs only so much they could do. I recommend this movie to anyone who enjoys a good sci fi flick and is different from all the others on screen in last years.

This is one of the finest Sci-Fi movie I've ever seen. The first 20 mins is pretty standard stuff until Tom starts to repeat. Not a minute is wasted in the boring dialogue or have-to story telling. My mind was grabbed till the end of the movie. I'm going to see this in IMax, and buy the Blu-ray for collection.

Edge of Tomorrow is one of the coolest Sci-Fi action flicks in recent memory.  It's Groundhog Day with a little Inception and Independence Day all thrown in together and makes for a great experience.  Tom Cruise and Emily Blunt both turn in solid performances as well as the supporting cast.  It would be easy for a movie that focuses so much on repetition to tire quickly, but with EoT it only stays interesting and paces well and keeps your interest.  Many props to the team tasked with the special effects as they're some of the best I've seen in recent years.  There are few things I felt like could have been done better with this movie and if you're only able to see one or two movies this spring/early summer, Edge of Tomorrow should be on your short list to see.

Not just another shoot em up alien movie.  It has an ingenious plot where Cruise runs into countless dead ends in his quest to break through.  Very good special effects, heavy on the action and although there is an obvious relationship thread I did not think it was too over the top.  Think GroundHog Day on steroids, but a lot more clever and entertaining.

Excellent movie. Every time it comes on TV I have to stop and watch parts of it. It just gets better and better.Yes there are some cliches and the VFX are pretty bad at times (more technical then artistic) but you overlook them because you are engaged.

Surprisingly awesome, I even enjoyed Tom Cruise in it although he is not my favourite. No stupid cliches and speeches that you would expect from american blockbuster. Even had a good laugh few times.The ending could have been better imo but overall great movie!!

Saw it on the day it came out in AUS. Great fun. The script and dialogue is not cheesy or cringe worthy. Decent solid film. Not like 47 Ronin. Similar quality of Dredd. Edge of Tomorrow and Godzilla 2014 are both great to watch.

Surprise hit of the summer for sure! Tom Cruise can still kick ass! Pros: Tom Cruise is awesome as well as Emily Blunt, Supporting cast is good, great sci-fi feel throughout, great action almost non stop, humorous at the right times, excellent premise Con: Ending was not very satisfying unfortunately Overall Edge of Tomorrow is a great watch and I would highly recommend.

I really don't know how to describe how I feel about this movie. I wanted to like it alot, and I think part of me did like it alot. But I know there's someone out there that could have done a few things differently with some of the story parts. There's alot to like here and the acting is so-so, which is better than I expected from a Cruise movie. But I feel like there's something missing here that could have made the movie over-the-top for me. I don't know what that is right now though. This didn't miss the mark completely for me but it could have been alot better.
Went into it knowing nothing about the plot and it ended up being a very good sci-fi aciton film. Well acted, The plot was fantastic, and it kept you interested through out. A definite must see.

One of the most surprisingly good films I've seen in a few years. The trailers really don't dive into the story, which better serves the execution of the plot (how most movies should treat their advertisements). The CG and cinematography is great and the acting is on par with most Cruise movies. The plot was what shocked me the most, or more specifically, the efficient use of time. There is no real filler and each scene is important in it's own way. The humor is also executed and timed extremely well and helps balance the tone and keeps the plot from taking itself too seriously. TL;DR: Awesome sci-fi film with great CG, acting, and plot execution. Go see this in theaters; it deserves every penny it grosses and then some.

Fantastic movie!! The story was top notch and the action and acting just awesome. The story is very new compared to everything out there now that just seems to rehash old and tired plot lines. Really have no complaints. Go see it!

I liked this a lot.  The story was well done and had me the edge of my seat when it wanted to and laughing when it wanted to.  I thought Tom Cruise did a great job.  I would have given it a 10 only if there was a little more battle variation scenes.  Cruise manages to get selected for these types of movies on a consistent basis.  I could care less about his politics.  He does a good job entertaining me in his movies.

I loved this movie. It was unexpectedly funny and the action moved the movie along at a fast pace which kept the audience from being bored. Emily blunt was a little out of character as a bad ass, but it still worked effectively. I really liked the evolution of cruises character in the movie, going from reluctant fighter to hero. This was much more entertaining than Oblivion, and I liked the plot much more as well. Overall I think Edge Of Tomorrow is a great popcorn movie.

A nice Sci-Fi movie with good action scenes. The story is not too complicated and the concept with repeating the events of one single day is not very original, but here it works well. The actors are decent, Emily Blunt especially. Overall, if you like sci-fi do not miss this, it's worth one watch (the second won't be very interesting), but you'll enjoy it.

Edge of Tomorrow exceeds low expectations with a very entertaining science-fiction action movie with great characters, great visual effects and a big sense of fun that didn't necessarily seem present in the trailers. There is a surprising amount of humor here also which never detracts from the tone but instead contributes to the enjoyment of the whole thing.

A familiar film premise gets a magnificent sci-fi spin in "Edge Of Tomorrow," Doug Liman's brilliantly shot and immaculately performed film featuring an expertly crafted narrative and some skillfully placed hilarity.

Great action, great visuals, and good concept. It was competently written, acted, and executed, however I felt it needed a little more depth which could have pushed the film into a real block buster. The lack of such made some elements such as the story and emotional connection to the characters feel a little bland. Although overall the movie was in no way bad, I liked it and wanted it to succeed....which it did, but it could have been even more.

I am no fan of Tom Cruise, especially when cast as a hero. He strikes me as a second hand car salesman; too slick to be true. I had therefore no problem to picture him as the protagonist in this movie: an officer charged with speaking to the media: lacking any combat-experience and intent on staying as far away from any combat zone as possible. When ordered to join the troops in what his superior deems to be a walk-in-the-park landing, Tom blackmails his commander to let him off the hook, which severely backfires on him, for he finds himself soon stripped of rank among the first to land with the reputation of being a deserter who pretended to be an officer to escape his duty. The enemy are called mimics for reasons that are never explained in the movie. They resemble metal octopuses, who move at incredible speed, mostly underground. They are aliens and that is about all we learn about them and that is all we need to learn about them. It suffices that they are a deadly force hell-bent on wiping out humanity(some decades in the future, somebody will write a book about how these  inhuman threats are a sign of the times, just like 70s and 80s had their disaster movies).D-day quickly turns into a massacre as the aliens wipe out the human forces before they can gain a foothold. Tom dies too, but before he does, he manages to kill one of the rarest of mimics, and finds himself returned to life one day before the landing takes place. Baffled Tom goes through the same day and tries to intervene the course of action in a haphazard way. It doesn't matter that he does because everyone dies.. and he does to.And then finds himself alive and back in time again. And so it goes. With each cycle Tom gets better because he knows what will happen, but also has a lot of time to gain experience, but dies nevertheless again and again.How does he get out of this predicament? He learns with each cycle and eventually he is aided by Emily Blunt, who has suffered from the same effects.Up till this sounds like a corny  predictable movie, but the script isn't as easy as you might think. The focus in this movie isn't on the humans vs aliens conflict, but on the interaction between Cruise and Blunt and their frantic efforts to turn the only advantage they have, foreknowledge, against the aliens. The key to their success is actually their ability to convince others that Tom possess that foreknowledge so that they help in the effort. And this is the hardest part. The script avoids giving us insight into the alien thinking. The mimics are kept as far away from the camera as possible and we never get a good clear view of them. This is smart for any alien eventually gets boring when shown too often.  An example is the landing, in which a lot of carnage happens before the aliens themselves actually show up.The movie even throws us of the track by introducing a twist in the story that makes the aliens even more sinister. Perhaps everything has been planned beforehand? Yet there are flaws in the movie, such as the way Tom ends up in the combat zone. And also the ending is a bit contrived and clearly written to give us a good feel. There is nothing against a movie with a  good ending, but one that forced makes for a lesser ending.Also one wonders why, having the possession of a flying craft at the start of the invasion, Tom and Blunt feel the need to have to get a car and a helicopter further land inward thus getting themselves killed time and again? Personally I think that the movie is at its best when Cruise and Blunt are together and it might have been more stronger if more time was to the group of people who aid him so that their characters would have mattered if and when they died.My learning points about this movie would be that some more time could have spent characterizing the people who eventually will aid Tom. Spend less time on the battles in the landing zone and the repeating scenes(which in themselves are shot in a way as to avoid boring repetition, which ought to be mentioned) and give more time to the final attack. My ranking gives this a 7 out of 10. This needs an explanation: in it's genre this movie is a 9.. but since ranks are given not to genre or category they are given an overall score. In it's genre of action sci-fi it desevers something of a 9. Which means it is pretty good.

One of the surprises of 2014 and one of the top three blockbusters of that year. Edge of Tomorrow is sci-fi, it´s action, it´s clever, it´s original and has a phenomenal pace and very well built structure. Tom Cruise is a real movie star for a reason, not the best of actors, but he gives his all and has all the charisma in the world. It was refreshing to see him play someone vulnerable and useless (at the beginning). Also Emily Blunt is so good in her role, proving she can be a great action movie star. One of the best times at the theatre lately. A must see for lovers of blockbusters.
This was just an awesome science fiction film. Everything felt so original and fresh with two great lead performances. I was hooked from the get go and left the theater completely satisfied.

Edge of Tomorrow is one of the most underrated Sci-Fi's in recent years and sadly it seems to have gone unnoticed by the majority. It remarkably manages to rip off so many films and video games whilst feeling refreshingly original also. At times it can feel like a game of spot the original source. In particular the time lapse elements which are very similar to Groundhog Day. If you over think the pattern and repetition of events, you can argue that there are flaws, as with any film of this kind. But it's smartly edited and it moves at such a rampant pace that you don't have time to dissect or question the flaws. Tom Cruise & Emily Blunt carry the film well and it's arguably Tom Cruise's best Sci-Fi to date. Visually this is a spectacular experience and the set pieces are some of the craziest and most exciting I've ever seen, in particular the battles on the beaches which are absolutely incredible. At first glance this just looks like another run of the mill action film with robots. Unlike the Transformers films for example, Edge of Tomorrow gets the human elements spot on and it doesn't rely solely on set pieces. But the set pieces happen to be spectacular too. So it's win-win and definitely worthy of much more recognition.

My favorite Tom Cruise movie of the past 20 years, and not just because you watch him die so many times(though that does play a substantial part). Excellent action and thematic elements mired by some very strange plot devices and an ending that leaves you wondering what the hell happened.

At first the whole film sounded pretty stupid and I was lying in the left.But now you have to say that he is really good.Visually superior and two big stars make it a good movie.The story is ok, and the film may be a bit too long but that's to get over.

I had a lot of hopes for this movie. And it totally delivered!!! Tom Cruise gives a fantastic performance. Emily Blunt gave a fantastic performance... you know what. Everyone gave a fantastic performance.This movie had a really fun story line. You never feel like the movie is dragging on at parts. I didn't  want it to end. The C.G.I is also incredible. I literally could not find any big problems in this movie even if their was a gun to my head. I actually saw this in 3d and this movie you can tell was not just converted to 3d last minute. I am already trying to figure out when I could see it again.

"Live. Die. Repeat" would have been a better title, but the studio ran an algorithm (probably) and went for a bland title instead, then failed to market the film at all. Critics liked it, so did audiences. "Groundhog Day" in a sci-fi action film and it works. Cruise is first rate at playing initially unlikeable characters and it's the same here. It's also, at times, very funny. Genuinely good. A big surprise,

One of the best if not -THE best sci fi movie of the later years, and the best adaption of a manga I 've seen the last decade.The plot is so consuming that someone who likes action will not feel bored not for even a moment.This is the drama-  action version of the famous comedy'' The groundhog day'' .Tom Cruise has delivered  one more time top notch entertainment .!

No es la mejor pelicula de acción y ciencia fincción que veo, pero tiene su propio estilo y creo que le falto algo que generara la sensación de emoción dentro del trama, pero me gusto creo que es muy buena opción para disfrutarla con palomitas y tener un buen rato en el cine.

Edge Of Tomorrow is phenomenal in every way. The acting was top notch, the graphics was completely believable, and it was well written. A good director could of made this movie horrible, but Doug Liman and the writers really thought out this movie. If I was to describe this movie it would be like Elysium meets Ground hogs day LOL. Edge of Tomorrow made me a believer in Tom Cruse, he is a wonderful actor, funny, and very likeable in this movie.

Ignore Critic Reviews, they're all fueled by greed, fear and prejudice.One of the top 3 best movies I've ever seen. When I saw the poster the movie looked strange to me, and I know a lot of people hate Tom Cruise for some reason, but he's a great actor, I'm not big on his older movies but this one was completely organic. I don't know if it's just me but when I watched it again I fully understood what was happening, I noticed a lot of things I missed the first time, the movie is so meticulously written and it's one of those movies everyone has to see, it's up there with The Matrix and Dark Knight. The movie revolves around time travel, it's not vague like you often see in sci-fi where you don't really understand what's happening, it's simple like Groundhog Day, speaking of Groundhog Day this movie is very inspired by Groundhog Day. EoT will make you feel nostalgia, fear, joy, etc. I won't spoilerize anything, all I can say is that it's one of the best movies ever made, it's gritty, it's dark and they did a great job avoiding plot holes, something Days of Future Past was chalk-full of. Avoid the Angry Joe review, he spoils the **** out of every single thing he reviews, he always tells you what happens at the end which ruins the movie/game. + Gritty/Dark/Scary+ Great acting+ Great production+ Great plot- Not gory enough- Action scenes are kind of hard to make out sometimes- Music isn't great and memorable like Inception/Dark Knight/Matrix/etc. I always said that music makes a gargantuan difference in quality but this movie did just fine without it
